channel.title: Magnetism
channel.description:
I had a test today and one of the problems was:
A magnet is suspended from a string and the string is then tied to a table. The magent hangs a little above the floor with room for some little balls. Below the magnet four (or three [or one if your Kane ;)]) steels balls are placed. The balls are not magnetized (and do not touch the magnet but are somewhat close). What happens?
A. The magnet repels the balls B. The balls repels the magnet C. The ball attract each other (picked this because something about the magnet magnetizing the balls 'n shit) D. The magnet attracts the balls
What's the correct answer and why?

item.title: Magnetism
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

FUCK… that was the state standards :mad:

p.s. i like your paint

Read full topic

item.title: Magnetism
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Magnet attracts balls, here’s a diagram I drew:

http://img691.imageshack.us/img691/1663/magnetz.png

  1. Charge is evenly distributed throughout the balls
  2. The magnet causes opposing charges to congregate at the area of the ball nearest to the magnet

In an alternative approach, A and B are synonymous, so you can eliminate them. Then you would choose between C and D.

Read full topic
